Hi everybody.  My name is Tyler Streeter.  I am a master's student 
in Human Computer Interaction at Iowa State University.  

Last fall in an AI class I began working on a project that I called 
Autonomous Virtual Humans.  This involved creating a simulated human 
body in a physical environment (using Open Dynamics Engine), 
controlling the human with a neural network, and training the neural 
network to perform certain behaviors (standing and jumping) with a 
genetic algorithm.  This page has more details about what I did last 
fall and what I'm currently doing: 
www.vrac.iastate.edu/~streeter/avh.html

I stumbled upon NEAT a few months ago and decided to integrate it 
into my project.  Here's a Windows executable of my latest version: 
www.vrac.iastate.edu/~streeter/files/avh_4-19-04.zip

(Note that I haven't done anything with file loading or saving yet.  
Some of the fitness functions need some tweeking.  Actually, a LOT 
of things need some tweeking.  The posted version should just give 
you a general idea of what I'm trying to do.)

I would love to get feedback from anyone who is interested (and has 
a Windows machine; Linux version coming later, btw).  I am planning 
to continue this work as my master's thesis next year, so I will be 
working on it for quite a while.

Thanks!

Tyler Streeter
